result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNTS:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and DV surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civl judgment.
Court waived nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
Court advised that under 48USC Section922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.

No unsupervised contact with T.T.S. without approval of the Court or agent or BMCW.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention program.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: 30 days as to each count. STAYED pending review hrg.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedy J Page-Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 27 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS as to each count, in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No unsupervised contact with T.T.S without approval of the court or agent, or BMCW.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in custody.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Received & Filed, Amended Information: 
COUNT 1 - Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor  
COUNT 2 - Battery, COUNT 1 - Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A Misdemeanor,

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION  
Original AMENDED Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
All other conditions of bail remain the same

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Elise Josephson.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant and sets cash bail.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing  on May 12, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 23 .

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant provided verification as to work scheduled to the court. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at defense counsel's request. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Anne A. Devitt.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Positive Drug Test. Court admonished defendant, but did not take further action. Court ordered defendant to provide verification that he had to work 4/8/2014 at 5:00 pm at next court appearance. Discussion regarding next court date. Case is rescheduled per Attorney Devitt's schedule to 4/10/2014 at 8:30 am in branch 23.

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court. Attorney Anne A. Devitt contacted, did not reach counsel.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, Justice Point Report. Defendant in court. Court reviewed report, positive drug test. Court admonished defendant to have a negative drug screen at next Justice Point appointment. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 4/18/2014.

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TTS dob 3/5/08 unless as approved per Children's Court orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved per the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Pedy J Page-Robinson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
